etymology.description: semantic: 匕(匕) (bǐ, "spoon") + phonetic: 甘(甘) (gān, "sweet") = spoon with something sweet -> tasty
etymology.interpretation: The character 旨(旨) (zhǐ, "tasty") combines 匕(匕) (bǐ, "spoon") with 甘(甘) (gān, "sweet"), suggesting the action of tasting something sweet with a spoon, thus conveying the idea of deliciousness.

examples.chinese: 厨师煮出的面条(廚師煮出的麵條)，味道极其旨(味道極其旨)。
examples.pinyin: Chú shī zhǔ chū de miàn tiáo, wèi dào jí qí zhǐ.
examples.english: The noodles cooked by the chef are extremely tasty.

examples.chinese: 那家饭店(那家飯店)，做的菜肴都很旨(做的菜肴都很旨)。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā fàn diàn, zuò de cài yáo dōu hěn zhǐ.
examples.english: The dishes at that restaurant are all tasty.
